intro: Hieracium brachiatum subsp. pseudobrachiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
